Note that, per unit electricity generated, CO 2 captured is greater than CO 2 avoided, because the efficiency penalty (see BECCS efficiency penalty, above) means that more CO 2 is emitted per GJ electricity. Care must be taken when comparing literature values as to whether they refer to CO 2 captured or avoided. Here we base calculations on CO 2 captured per unit biomass combusted.
